programs.name: Automotive Technology

Recording assessments, results, and treatment plans.
Working with medical teams to improve patient care.

careers.description: Evaluates and treats cognitive and behavioral disorders resulting from brain injuries or neurological conditions.

careers.title: School Psychologist

competencies.description: Identifying learning and behavioral needs of students.
Providing individual and group support to students.
Developing strategies to improve student behavior.
Handling emergencies and critical situations in schools.
Working with teachers, parents, and administrators.
Reporting progress and findings to stakeholders.
Using evidence-based practices to support learning.

careers.description: Supports student learning and mental health through assessment, counseling, and intervention programs.

careers.title: Forensic Psychologist

competencies.description: Evaluating offenders for mental health and legal purposes.
Preparing detailed psychological reports for legal cases.
Adhering to legal and professional ethical standards.
Analyzing complex legal and psychological issues.
Applying evidence-based practices to forensic cases.
Working with law enforcement, attorneys, and correctional staff.

careers.description: Applies psychology to criminal and legal contexts, assessing offenders and advising courts.

careers.title: Rehabilitation Psychologist

competencies.description: Evaluating physical, cognitive, and emotional functioning.
Working with healthcare teams and patients.
Using evidence to improve rehabilitation outcomes.
Recording progress and treatment plans accurately.

careers.description: Helps individuals recover from injuries or disabilities through psychological and rehabilitative care.

careers.title: Health Psychologist

competencies.description: Studying how behavior impacts physical health.
Supporting patients in managing health conditions.
Conducting studies on health behavior and outcomes.
Educating patients and communities on health strategies.
Working with healthcare professionals and organizations.
Upholding ethical standards in research and practice.
Interpreting health data to guide interventions.

careers.description: Focuses on how psychological factors affect health, developing strategies for wellness and prevention.

careers.title: Neuropsychology Researcher

competencies.description: Planning and conducting neuroscience and psychology studies.
Interpreting complex cognitive and behavioral data.
Publishing findings and presenting research results.
Designing experiments to answer critical questions.
Following ethical guidelines in human research.
Working with interdisciplinary teams in research projects.
Analyzing results and drawing accurate conclusions.
Managing timelines, resources, and deliverables effectively.

careers.description: Conducts advanced research in brain-behavior relationships to advance psychology knowledge.
